snippet: A hearing in federal court in Oklahoma examines whether executions should resume there after a botched procedure in the execution of Clayton D. Lockett in April.
abstract: Oklahoma federal court hears testimony from anesthesiologist Dr David Lubarsky in connection with botched execution of inmate Clayton D Lockett that led to moratorium on death penalty in state; anesthesiologist states that Lockett was probably conscious and in great pain from inappropriate use of drugs used to kill him.
lead_paragraph: A hearing in federal court in Oklahoma examines whether executions should resume there after a botched procedure in the execution of Clayton D. Lockett in April.

headline.main: Doctors Say Flaws Led to Suffering in Oklahoma Execution
headline.print_headline: Doctors Say Flaws Led to Suffering in Execution
